citation.article-title: Amnibacterium kyonggiense gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the family Microbacteriaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Amnibacterium (Am.ni.bac.teâ€²ri.um. L. n. amnis -is river; L. neut. n. bacterium staff, rod; N.L. neut. n. Amnibacterium a rod associated with a river).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-positive, oxidase-negative, catalase-positive, non-motile and short rod-shaped.
The predominant menaquinones are MK-11 and MK-12.
The major fatty acids are anteiso- and iso-branched.
The diagnostic diamino acid of the cell-wall peptidoglycan is l-2,4-diaminobutyric acid.
Phylogenetically the genus belongs to the family Microbacteriaceae.
The type species is Amnibacterium kyonggiense.
